name: Lebanese Tabbouleh
description: We think of tabbouleh as a bulgur salad with lots of parsley and mint. But real Lebanese tabbouleh is a lemony herb salad with a little bit of fine bulgur, an edible garden that you can scoop up with romaine lettuce heart leaves or simply eat with a fork.
keywords: appetizer, dairy-free, halal, healthy, kosher, low cholesterol, low-sodium, low sugar, nut-free, vegan, vegetarian, fine bulgar wheat, fresh herbs, tomato, summer
recipeIngredient: Juice of 2 large lemons, to taste
3 cups chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley (from 3 large bunches)
1/2 pound ripe tomatoes, very finely chopped
Salt, preferably kosher salt, to taste
1 romaine lettuce heart, leaves separated, washed and dried

recipeInstructions.text: Place the bulgur in a bowl, and cover with water by 1/2 inch. Soak for 20 minutes, until slightly softened. Drain through a cheesecloth-lined strainer, and press the bulgur against the strainer to squeeze out excess water. Transfer to a large bowl, and toss with the garlic, lemon juice, parsley, mint, tomatoes, scallions and salt. Leave at room temperature or in the refrigerator for two to three hours, so that the bulgur can continue to absorb liquid and swell.
Add the olive oil, toss together, taste and adjust seasonings. Serve with lettuce leaves.
